abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of the project is
            considered deficient. Although supervision by the Bank was
            mostly timely and responsive to the changing needs of the
            Borrower, the overly-dimensioned capability of the Borrower
            was conducive to a deficient Bank's performance, in
            addition to the design flaws during preparation, and,
            expectations set at appraisal. Regarding the policy reform
            conditionality, in response to recommendations by the Bank,
            both the Borrower's and the Ministry of Agriculture and
            Livestock (MAC) performed below expectations. The key
            lessons convey that project objectives and loan instruments
            should be carefully analyzed, and consistent with
            preparation rationale, since initially the project was
            prepared as a fast disbursing loan, but changed to an
            investment loan at negotiations. Furthermore, it is
            paramount that the implementation capacity of the Borrower
            be in tune with the scope of the project. Sound ownership of
            implementing agencies should be confirmed while preparation
            work is involved; effective implementation and
            sustainability results from a commitment between the Bank
            and the Borrower. Additionally, those investments to be
            financed by the operation, should be identified well ahead
            of negotiations, to prevent delays during implementation.
            Risks should be monitored, and, project management should be
            consistent throughout the project.

5082166.majtheme: Public sector governance,Rural development,Rule of law

abstracts.cdata!:
The project supports the
            Government's objectives of increasing sectoral
            efficiency and achieving sustainable agricultural growth and
            exports. This will be accomplished by carrying out a reform
            program to restructure the incentive system; expanding
            public sector expenditure on agricultural infrastructure and
            services to improve productivity; increasing the
            availability of credit to assist the private sector to
            adjust to the new incentive structure and increase exports;
            and, strengthening the sector's institutional framework
            and project planning capabilities to facilitate
            implementation of the reform program and enhance efficiency
            in the use of public resources.
